alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 8:41AM PST until January 06 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 18 to 25 feet. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The High Surf Warning was converted to a High Surf Advisory. While wave heights have trended downwards, buoys are still reporting dangerous waves being generated near the shore. Stringent caution is advised near the coastline and Never Turn Your Back to the Ocean!
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
